Key Match Events: Jeremy Villeneuve of Mauritius won a set-piece and unleashed the ball into the box, but Jeakson Singh made the clearance.
Striker Manvir Singh was sent through on goal by Anirudh Thapa and he challenged the Mauritius goalkeeper Kevin Obrian with his left-footed strike, but the custodian saved it.
There was a fine cross by Lallianzuala Chhangte from the right wing, but Thapa could not head it accurately.
Mauritius came close to scoring but the shot missed the target by a whisker.
Pre-Game Insights: India, ranked 124th in the FIFA chart, faced a lower-ranked Mauritius (174th) in the Intercontinental Cup opener.
India, ranked 55 spots above Mauritius, failed to find the back of the net despite enjoying possession early on.
Mauritius looked more threatening and created more opportunities than India in the first half.
Post-Match Reflections: India showed a lot more urgency and enterprise in the second half, looking to create chances and put the visitors under pressure.
Both teams continued to create the occasional chances but lacked the finishing touches, with Mauritius often looking the better team on display.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Manolo Marquez's stint as Indian football team's head coach began with a goalless draw against Mauritius.
India's Lallianzuala Chhangte was in action, but couldn't convert opportunities into goals.
